etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in Alexander Malcolm (1685–1763). From ancient Greek μάγαδις an octave concord, also as adjective in unknown sense designating a flute, probably from μαγαδ-, μαγάς (although the latter word is first attested only in Hellenistic Greek)

definitions: Used to denote what was believed to have been a type of musical instrument known in ancient Greece.
